features: Provides a clean shave while it softens, smoothes, soothes, and moisturizes your skin-use on legs, face, and underarms
Let this one-of-a-kind moisture shave shaving cream nourish naturally
Goldenseal to protect against nicks and scratches
Kiss my face cool mint moisture shave cream helps to soothe, smooth, hydrate, and soften your skin
Packed with botanicals like goldenseal, lemongrass and aloe this cool mint scented formula gives an invigorating, close shave.
body.description: Treat yourself to moisturizing indulgence as you shave with Kiss My Face Moisture Shave Creams. This Cool Mint scented formula gives an invigorating, close shave. A 4 in 1 cream formula that soothes, smooths, hydrates and softens.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Kiss My Face Moisture Shave Fragrance Free Shaving Cream, Olive and Aloe *Formulated With: Olive and Aloe Gluten-Free Ingredients No Parabens No Phthalates No SLS Vegan Friendly Ingredients Not Animal Tested No Artificial Flavors No Artificial Fragrances Directions Wet hands, lather in palm and apply. Shave and rinse.Works well with shaving brush. *Refer ingredient list Fragrance Free Shaving Cream Nourish with the botanical blends in Kiss My Face 4-in-1 shave creams! There is never a dull moment with our moisture rich shaving cream. Experience a shaving cream difference that you can see and feel. Our 'recipe' of ingredients doesn't contain parabens or phthalates and since our products are consistently better, you can feel confident about using them. Kiss it & make it better. This Fragrance Free formula is great for a close shave, and sensitive skin Our 4-in-1 Fragrance Free Shaving Cream is second to none with its natural ingredients that help to soothe, moisturize, and provide a smooth, close shave for those with sensitive skin. First, Vitamin E and oils soften your skin. Second, our cream formula provides a smooth, close shave. Next, Golden Seal, Lemongrass and Aloe help to soothe. Last, Olive and Coconut Oils moisturize. All you need for a comfy shave. This Fragrance Free formula is great for a close shave, and sensitive skin. Lather with wet hands – apply, shave and rinse.

About Kiss My Face Since our humble beginnings in the early '80s (yes, way back in the 1900s) Kiss My Face has been a cruelty-free company, never testing on animals. We continue to evolve as new information and ingredients become available. Today, all of our products are paraben-free, phthalate-free, and SLS free. In addition, our products are free from dyes and synthetic colors such as F, D, and C. Kiss My Face products are pH balanced and are formulated without carmine, lanolin, mineral oils, petroleum, or nano particles. It’s only natural to love our products. The Kiss My Face Mission: Absorb this! At Kiss My Face we believe that nature creates the best ingredients. It’s our mission to combine these natural and organic ingredients in body care products that are innovative and uniquely effective, to make you look good and feel good from head to toe… and a few stops in between.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great shave cream
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this shave cream for several years. It provides a great friction-free shave.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Shave I've Found
reviews.reviewText: I've been using the Kiss My Face Moisture Shave for years and would never use anything else. After trying dozens of different shave creams, I have found nothing that compares to the KMF shave cream.As someone with very sensitive facial skin, along with thick, coarse facial hair, I really need a cream that will protect my skin while allowing for a very close shave. KMF lubricates the skin incredibly well and I never end up with irritation after shaving. Personally, I love the smell of the Peaceful Patchouli - it's my favorite. But each of the other scents are very pleasant and don't linger. I have found that the product tends to work best if you take a moment to massage the cream on the face before beginning to shave.If you're wanting a more natural shave cream, I can't recommend this product highly enough!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No razor-burn, good glide, not doesn't dry you out
reviews.reviewText: I've tried all kinds of shaving products from foams/gels/soaps/lotions. They all essentially get the job done. I've found that for my face, the soaps/brush end up being too drying, and some of the "moisturizing" lotions are sometimes just too greasy. The foams & gels are okay, but I don't need a can rusting in my shower. This product is just right for my face in the spectrum of moisturizing qualities. This has excellent glide with both disposable multi-blade razors and with classic safety razors and also rinses away cleanly.After a few months in silicone refillable travel tubes it dries out and is a little challenging to re-constitute

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2013
reviews.reviewText: Overview- Great for guys who shave traditionally. Maybe for gals, too, but I can't speak to that! It gives a lot of creamy lather with excellent slickness. The slickness spoils me because I can go over the same spot without causing irritation more times than I can with other creams or soaps. It took a little courage to get past the thought thought that KMF stuff is for women. However, it gets lots of raves on Badger and Blade, a traditional shaving forum that is mostly male.Why didn't I give it 5 Stars? - This cream is labeled fragrance free, and I believe they did not add any fragrance to it. However, it still has a distinctive smell. I think the smell is the natural smell of the ingredients that is normally covered by the added fragrance in other creams. I didn't think too much of it, until my wife kept asking why the bathroom smelled like chemicals when I shaved? So, I switched to KMF Lavender with Shea Butter. I think it has less smell than this cream, and the added Shea butter is great for my skin. And my wife is happy. I was worried about smelling like lavender all day, but I barely smell it while I'm shaving, let alone when I'm done.How I use it- I use a shaving brush to build a good lather. I soak the brush while I shower, then shave right after getting out of the shower while my whiskers are still wet. I rub some of this cream all over my beard. How much to use will vary buy person, start out with a dollop about 1 1/2 inches long. After I've applied cream to my face, I take the brush out of the mug where it was soaking, shake a little water out of it, and begin rubbing the brush gently in swirls all over the cream. After a few seconds, it will start to build lather. The large bubbles will get finer and finer until I have a nice thick lather. If I think it is too dry, I dip the very tips of the brush in water, and continue swirling. When it's ready, I smooth it over my face and pick up the excess lather with the brush. The lather now resides in the brush and I set it on it's base, and reapply between each shaving pass.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My husband loves this brand. He like the unscented. He uses a brush and says the Kiss My Face brand gives him a great foam with his brush. I always have to buy this when he gets low. he loves it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's good, but I prefer something else.
reviews.reviewText: Don't expect a lather when rubbing into the skin. The 'film' you get from this product is to coat your face with a slippery liquid such that your razor can easily glide across your beard/skin and you can minimize your skin from razor irritation and cuts. This concepts works well, but the down-side, in my opinion, is that (1) your razor may get clogged with this somewhat sticky substance and require you to use high pressure water to force the substance out of the multi-blade spaces of your razor, or use a tooth brush to remove the blockages, and (2) your skin will get very slippery with this substance and you will need to repeatedly wash your face to thoroughly remove the substance. If you have the time and not in a rush, then this product is recommended.I usually mix this product with liquid soap or just use liquid soap to shave with my Gillette five-blade razor. After use and rinsing, I pour alcohol over the blades and let dry.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2013
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for my partner because it has good quality ingredients, is cruelty-free, and I felt it would be gentle on his skin. It has exceeded both of our expectations!I first purchased it along with a Merkur Model 180 Long Handled Safety Razor, and I had hoped it would help him with the "learning curve" of using a traditional razor. He was ecstatic and said that it certainly did make shaving a breeze. He loves this product, and I love the perfect light patchouli scent. (It's not that heavy perfumey scent of some men's shaving products, but just a light hint of a very pleasant fragrance).Next time we're going with the larger package.
I loved how long this product lasts compared to foam shaving cream. Smells great too.
Best shaving cream ever! I wouldn't use anything else.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 8, 2017
reviews.reviewText: lovely moisturizing shave cream but the squirty bottle doesn't work!

Un gel de rasage d'un très bon rapport qualité/prix. Il ne vaut p-e pas d'autres marques comme American Crew (et encore je trouve que ça se discute) mais ce n'est pas le même prix non plus. Bref un bon rapport qualité/prix pour ce gel qui mélange aloe vera, huile d'olive, citronnelle et fleur d'oranger. De plus il est conçu sans pareben, phthalates, agents de conservation, colorant artificiel, etc.
